par.text: Francium is a radioactive element of very low stability. It is a metal, a member of the lithium group. All its isotopes are radioactive. The longest-lived isotope is francium-223 with a half-life of 21 minutes. Due to the low stability of francium, its properties have never been studied in detail. Francium was discovered in France by Marguerite Perey and named after the country.
